scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. Following that, during a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You acknowledged Monica's feelings and suggested a pragmatic approach to prioritize work, but the tension remained high. [Bob] then leaned back in his chair, crossing his arms, and said, 'Prioritizing won't change the fact that we’re understaffed and overworked. What’s the point?' You tried to motivate the team by recalling past successes. [Monica] sighed deeply and said, 'I just don't see how working smart will get us through this. What if we miss the deadline? What then?' [Bob] looked at you expectantly. You then tried to keep the team positive and focused, acknowledging Monica's concerns and encouraging the team to make the best of the situation. The tension still lingers.
scenes.description: [Bob] glances at his watch and says, 'Staying positive is great, but what happens when we’re burnt out and still not done? We need more concrete steps.' [Monica] frowns, clearly sharing his concerns.

options.text: Bob, I understand. Let's outline a more detailed plan with clear milestones and assign specific responsibilities to everyone.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's concerns and suggested a concrete plan to mitigate stress, demonstrating high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: I get it. How about we schedule regular check-ins to monitor our progress and adjust our plans as needed?
options.analysis: You proposed a practical approach to manage the workload through regular check-ins, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: We’ve done this before, and we can do it again. Let’s stay focused and take it one step at a time.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team by emphasizing past successes and the importance of staying focused, demonstrating high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
